reviewText: We watched this as a family one Sunday after church.  It touched us all, even the 3 year old.  The children learned the importance of listening to parents and listening to their conscience. Very well done film.  Not cheesy or overly dramatic.

One of the most direct and powerful films of its kind I have ever seen.  For me it drove home the message that the veil between us and the unseen world is very thin.  Moreover, the more obedient we are, the more we are allowed to see of the Lord's hand in our lives.

This is a story straight out of the personal narrative and experience of the director's family and engagingly put into film.  It is very short, the body of the film being a little less than 15 minutes, but I found it powerful and inspiring and so have all those I have shared it with.  The music is incredibly uplifting. It is a wonderful and understated telling of a child's experience with the hand of God in their life and the lasting impact of that moment.  This film has appeal and relevance to children, teens and adults and  never becomes overblown or "cheesy" as my teenagers put it. It's a great springboard for discussion on topics of obedience and divine intervention in  human life.  This is not a feature length film but a powerful and worthwhile investment nonetheless.
This Movie Is Not worth 1 dollar it is to short and ridiculous. thats all
Touching movie. It may be  short but you  can drink a two beers (most movies) or take a shot glass of liIt doesn.t need to be long to get its point across. God is good.

I feel rather skeptical in believing this story. Overall it has the too good to be true feel of most publications put out by LDS sources. I'd have to see an actual authentic journal entry, and even then.. well, I don't know. Also, in all my years growing up I never once heard of a female Mormon missionary until well into the 1900's. I (Gina) googled the topic just now, and the only sources claiming otherwise are LDS sources. In any case, I didn't enjoy this film; it left me feeling like I've just developed a new toothache.
Miracles happen everyday; each time we receive the breath of life from Jesus, and open our eyes to a new day. This was beautiful.
A very short film but powerful.  My Sunday school class enjoyed the lesson of obedience it taught.
.I believe that Mormons can be true believers in Christ, I believe there are angels that watch over us and rejoice over our salvation, but the center of all is Christ Jesus.

I have no doubt that God sends His angels to us. I felt my van being lifted gently to the side of the road, as I was doing 55mph and a big duly truck ran a stop sign. I thought I felt a tiny little nick and upon checking, I discovered a small scratch above my rear driver's side tire on the fender. My daughter was with me that day. We both felt the van lifted and the slight nick. We both believe God sent an angel. I loved this short film.
A lovely story and gave me peace.

This was a short video and I was left wanting more also. It reminded me of a song that was a hit several years back, that a friend of mine sang for a CD for a Non-profit called "Angels Among Us". The videos message is very simple and clear. We are all children of God. He loves us all the same. And He does send Angels to us in our time of need.
This film only lasts about 15 minutes,but it left me feeling whole. I cried like a baby. I made my son watch it with me. We both really enjoyed it. I highly recomend.

This was a lovely story, and I was hoping to see more.  I did not realize the whole movie is only 14 minutes in length.  With prime membership, I watched it for free.  However, I thought it was only a small clip that was free, a short preview.  I then purchased it, believing that I would be watching an entire full length movie.  Nope, the movie is only a total of 14 minutes, and that's it!  A 14 minute movie at a rental price of $4.99!  I am disappointed that Amazon did not send me a message indicating that I was purchasing the same thing that I had just viewed for free.

All the wet-blanket folks who have criticized this film amuse me. The film was short and to the point.  Much better than an extended version that one would have to yawn through just to get to the real story.  I absolutely loved this!

If you're a Mormon, you will probably like this syrupy-sweet film. It was pretty lame and sappy for a general audience. If they had a rating for "Okay, but kind of a waste of time" I would use it, but two stars will have to suffice.

To begin with, everyone has the right to believe in whatever it is they want to believe in. For me, I am rather skeptical about these so called "miracles", especially those which provide no real evidence other than the ramblings of a man suffering from a violent fever. To top it off, a girl fails to say anything to her father about this event until she is finally confronted with her brother's rambling tale. It is most likely that she now saw a way out of her lack of initial honesty because she knew it would be pleasing to her father if she confirmed "the miracle".  All of this, together with the way stories change in their telling with the passage of time simply gives those who choose to believe something to hang on to. And good luck to them. If it makes them feel better about themselves and/or their lives, where is the harm in that.  But please, don't try to make money out of it or your belief ends up as nothing more than the ramblings of a fever ridden guy on which the whole story waas based.
